thread.title: Chelsea Beach Arcade sells for $8.3 million
thread.title_full: Chelsea Beach Arcade sells for $8.3 million

title: Chelsea Beach Arcade sells for $8.3 million
text:
A Chinese investor has pounced on another shopping centre, snapping up the Chelsea Beach Arcade for $8.3 million.
Lascorp Development Group sold the asset on a sharp passing yield of 6.3 per cent in a deal negotiated by CBRE's Mark Wizel, Justin Dowers and Rorey James.
The two-level Arcade on the beach side of Chelsea has 11 specialty retailers, including Anytime Fitness, a BWS and Bakers Delight.
The sale follows a string of recent sub $10 million retail deals.
Advertisement A local investor purchased Strathfieldsaye Plaza for $6.75 million, while another Chinese investor recently bought 68-82 Canterbury Road in Canterbury for $8.9 million.
Offshore Chinese buyers have been particularly active. They purchased the Oakleigh IGA for $3 million prior to auction and snapped up Gisborne Foodworks for $7 million.
Overseas investors were looking for secure, income-producing investments, Mr Wizel said.
They were also becoming more comfortable with buying in regional areas, he said.
Mr Dowers said Chinese buyers were reacting to the lower Australian dollar. The sharemarket turmoil gripping the country was likely to prompt a flight of capital, he said.
